Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: chernova_st
Reviews.Content: The convenient location is in the heart of Venice, behind the San Marco, nearby there are many restaurants and shops, close waterbus station, staff English speaking, friendly, good continental breakfast. The main contingent of europeans. Street in the evening time quiet and calm, isolated rooms, inside bathroom and toilet and all amenities. The price for such a hotel was acceptable. But it is difficult to find the hotel, if you have no maps.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing going for this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Vafootprints
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the reception was very rude. Reservations were made online for a double bed room. The simple misunderstanding that there would be 2pax not one pax staying was received as if it was the biggest problem of the year. An additional cost was added for the additonal person, fine. Later, we found out that they charged double the "city tax" compared other hotels. The room, long story short- hairs on the headboard, pillows smelt of mildew, carpet at least 10 years old, and wouldn't dare shower in the bathroom. We immediately left the room after checking in to explore Venice. After having dinner we arrived again, greeted by another rude receptionist as if we were inconveniencing him to buzz us in a 10 pm (curfew 12- or you will be locked out, we were warned). Breakfast was not fresh, mostly packaged food and a push button coffee machine to make latte etc. as found in 7-11. Needless to say we checked out the next morning, found no need to unpack in this unfriendly and dirty hotel. My mother had stayed years ago with great reviews, looks like management stopped caring not long after.

Reviews.Title: “Actually not bad!”
Reviews.Author: NiXNoX
Reviews.Content: We had a double private room as it was reserved. After reading some of the reviews here I was a bit concerned about the cleanliness and the bed bugs but I was actually positively surprised after the check-in. Fortunately We had a good experience. Not bed bugs at all. The room was clean enough and also the bed sheet. We had just a little problem with the TV, so the very helpful staff came to help us at night. After a while we realized that the cable was not attached to the wall. After all I was happy. Not bad at all for one night. Good price and very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amrita C
Reviews.Content: For me and my husband it was the first Europe visit. Venice was too good but the price that we paid for this dingy accomodation was exhorbitant. A small room with a bed gave hardly any place to stand, bathroom was sticking and the staff very unfriendly. The final straw in hat was when we saw the breakfast......cereals, jam, milk and bread!!!!! The pictures shown on net are very misleading! Amrita C

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Accomodations Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth W
Reviews.Content: This was the worst motel I have ever stayed and I have been in third world countries. There were 32 dead mosquitoes on the walls and ceilings. The hallway had a hole in the floor that was covered up with a square of carpet. It was disgustingly nasty. The doorframe to our room was broken. So, the door would not lock. The staff after 10:00 p.m. was rude. I talked with four other patrons who were totally dissatisfied as well. Stay away from this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in Europe”
Reviews.Author: RSearth
Reviews.Content: The worst experience in Europe. I have traveled extensively and never found such a hotel. Its worse than some of the poky places in small towns of underdeveloped countries. The carpets was worn out on the staircases. The bathroom had moss all over the place. It was stinking. And to top it all the staff were not concerned at all on the feedback. Don't go there, unless you are out of your mind. The price isn't cheap either

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: jaw787
Reviews.Content: Expedia said this hotel had air conditioning, an elevator and free wi-fi. No it didn't. And if I didn't clean a ton of hair out of the shower drain, the water would still be standing there. The included breakfast consisted of 'no-name' corn flakes with room-temperature milk. Sleep in the street before you stay here...you'll be more comfortable - and it's cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lissethg103
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in the middle of all the shops in Venice. Conviently located. Great Value good price for a room that accomodated 4 people. It had nice windows in the room that looked down to shops very nice views. The beds were comfortable the only downfall only 1 person was able to take a warm shower in the morning not sure what happened to the water temperature- it was not a big deal since we only stayed here 1 night. We were disappointed with the breakfast not much served very small dining room- we skipped it. Overall good value for the price we paid. The attendant was super nice made us feel very comfortable upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “ok for 1-2 nights, don't let the luggage at the reception!!!”
Reviews.Author: wise_woman007
Reviews.Content: stayed there with a friend of mine for 2 nights and if my luggage didn't get lost, i would say the hotel is ok for 1-2 nights, but it is not worth its price. The room was horrible but the bed was ok. The furniture was damaged, the bathroom was disgusting and our first night was terrible cold cause the radiators didn't work. But we told the reception and they checked it out. I don't need luxurary for 1-2 nights, but you didn't fell comfortable at all. It was ok. Don't book breakfast, it is not worth at all! The last day me and my friend let the luggage at the reception because our flight took off late in the evening. That was the biggest mistake ever. Only my luggage, which was the only one key-locked, got "lost" and the receptionist didn't really want to help us at all. We had to get our plane and we told him that we want him to write something for the police but he didn't want to. He called his collegue and after a long time she send him a text by e-mail. We were few seconds just in time to get the last bus to the airport!! it was horrible...at the airport i made a charge against unknown person. That was my first stay in Venice;)

Reviews.Title: “Advisable for its great location and if you simply just want to have an accommodation in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dinmo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more accessible and easier to find when you stop at the Piazza San Marco ferry stop. If you stop at Rialto bridge, it is hard to find especially when it's your first time in Venice. But you can ask the shop sellers and they'll guide you. We printed out a map from the hotel website directing one to the hotel so we got there from the Rialto bridge. As soon as we became more familiar with Venice, we realized that the hotel is in a great location. The receptionist took care of us as soon as we arrived. Our room was nice but not fancy. The bathroom was equipped with white towels and tiny soaps. One thing we didn't like was how filthy the shower curtain was. We spent one morning taking a shower with that filthy curtain. Then we thought of asking the chambermaid to replace it and she readily did so. Our room was fronting an alley frequented by tourists so if you don't want noise, you might want to consider other hotels. Surprisingly, we slept well for the for the 4 nights we were there. The internet connection at the hotel is not efficient. We had to go to the lower floor to gain access thereto. And the receptionist told us that there is an unsecured internet connection, so he was like saying that the hotel internet is not that reliable. Breakfast at the hotel consists of bread, assorted cookies, muesli, coffee, milk, juice, cereals, and yogurt. There's not much variety but you can still be full with these. We spent our 4-day stay exploring Venice and other Italian cities so we didn't get to spend that much in the hotel room. I think the hotel is overpriced for its services, but since it's in Venice, which is one of the most expensive Italian cities, we couldn't complain. Besides, it is a two-star hotel only so we couldn't expect too much from it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and helpful staff - but beware the tide by that time/end of Nov./”
Reviews.Author: musixbox
Reviews.Content: We were moved from another hotel and came to be luckily better choice. The last day when it was raining it was difficult to get there without rubber boots but if you are creative enough no problem.

Reviews.Title: “An experience!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy045
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights it was what it said on the packet 2 star no frills. No hot water at peak times but if you timed it right it was fine. Breakfast was very basic but plenty of it, bread rolls, jam, cheese spread, cereal and juice. Plenty of tea and coffee. The furniture was shabby but the bed linen was clean as was the towels. Beds were made every day and rooms tidied. The staff were friendly enough and one of them was very helpful informing us of good cheap places to eat. This was a good place if you are not expecting luxury and it's central location made up for it. I would recommend eating away from the centre as we found good food at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Repair”
Reviews.Author: k_jh11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single with ensuite on the second floor that is badly in need of repairs. The phone plug hangs out of the wall and several of the power points are pushed in or otherwise damaged. Ensuite had a broken/missing toilet paper hanger, the toilet seat slid to one side as soon as you sat down, the shower head was damaged and leaked from most sections, and the shower screen was missing an entire pane. Bed wasn't uncomfortable though, and I got a fairly good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “love-less”
Reviews.Author: pittp
Reviews.Content: Allthough the location is great, jus a few hundred meters behind Piazza San Marco, the Hotel is run without "love". The older rooms are furnished with crappy furniture, the bathrooms do not have warm water at "rush hour", the mosquitoes from other reviews are still there in masses (but most likely in other hotels as well). They changed our reservationd my wife and I had to stay one noght in a 10 sqm room wthout heating, water and everything else: They have some recently renovated rooms 101, 201 and 301 as far as I know and thay are ok.. but the beds are stil crappy and noisy ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Just nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AminaBarcelona
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four and share a great clean and warm room with a big and clean bath too.As far as it's not a luxory place, and by what I have listened about the average hotels in this city I really recommend this place to whoever who wants to have a short period of time in this city and wants a nice place to rest. Excellent location as well as well rate quality-price.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Giganiggas71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Astoria last November,when all Venice is quiet and there are not crowdy storms of people everywhere.The city is amazing in this period..you can walk around easily and don't have to wait hours and stand lines on monuments and gondolas. Astoria staff was warm and helpful and welcome us with kindness and nice words.They also gave us a map with all directions and hints on this beautiful town. Easy walking distance to all the famous places,since this Hotel is located in a very tactical spot that helped us to save time on our tours.S.Marco square,Rialto Bridge and the Arsenale are a few steps and there are nice gift shops in the neighbourhood. Astoria,like most of the Hotels and restaurants were renuvating rooms and buildings in November,painting walls,hydric mantainance etc.but we didn't hear any noise or disturbance...it was like anyone was in the Hotel. It's a quiet area,even in the night...it was a bit cold in the rooms but heaters reached a perfect temperature at night. Rooms are clean and safe and furnitures are a bit old..that's not the Danieli but,you are in S.Marco(and believe me..this is really important) What to say ??? If you are looking for a tactical and cheap spot that will enable you to reach everything easily and fast...Astoria is the perfect location for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Shortyworks
Reviews.Content: We first booked our hotel at B&B Rota but when we arrived there they informed us that they overbooked and sent us to the Astoria. HORRIBLE PLACE! Our bathroom was COVERED in black mold. Never seen anything so bad in my life. The room had a lot of mosquitos as well, which kept us up at night. I ended up getting really sick from the mold and the staff did nothing to help us. Nothing at all. We bought masks to wear our second night there, since we could get no refund or anything, and ended up leaving at 4am just to get out of that hotel. DO NOT stay here. We did end up asking if we could upgrade to a more expensive room, and when I asked to see it first, it also had a lot of mold.

Reviews.Title: “flexible!!”
Reviews.Author: stigma
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for only 1 night ,i found it while we were walking and looking for budget hotel and it's rate was suitable for us ,but!!!!!it is only worthy for sleeping i mean passing out cause if you are tourist who like to spend some time in your room i do not recommend this one!!!!please do take shower before checking in cause you might find it impossible in your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: Leonidas74
Reviews.Content: I had a very interesting experience in this little but nice Venetian hotel. It's situated in the central Venice,S.Marco is really close,Rialto is at 5 minutes walking.The S.Marco neighbourhood where the hotel is,is safe and quiet.Always security men and tourists until late night.Really close to the main popoular and attractive nightlife place,S.Margherita.In this period you are a few steps from the main Biennale festival shows and museums. Wonderful place to stay,with staff always pleased and kind to have new guests,talkative and helpful with all customers. You can have breakfast in the morning.all you can eat is on the buffet,i loved the homemade orange juice,the pastries and the sorts of nutella and jams they have. You can even surf the web at very affordable prices,wireless connection is available in the hotel,and you can book hotels for free just in case you are on the way of a new place. I enjoyed lots of concerts and casino attractions with the tickets they sell at the front desk. I forgot the hair dryer and they gave me one at the reception. They booked restaurants for me and arranged my return trip to the train station because i was lost.The staff is incredible. My room was on the 3rd floor( i can see the S.Marco bell tower from my window),always cleaned and perfumed every day,maid helped many times with my baby. And i ate lots of good food in the restaurants close to the hotel. i loved this place,it's simple,essential,but you will feel fine and enjoy all Venice from here Not to mention the good experience i had with the gondola tour they booked for me.No doubt,i felt like home.There s no elevator here but the hotel is little,you won't need to walk miles to arrive in your room,and it's never noisy.They even lock the door at night for customers safety,and in the week end they are always open so you can return late if you want to. I m planning to return in Venice in a couple of years,and i will make sure to stay here again. Positive and cheap experience guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrankCastle
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews on this hotel,i was scared to go in there.i booked in advance so i can't retrieve my reservation or i had to pay a penalty. I left home in pain,i read in these pages....mosquitos,broken doors,horrible bathrooms and so on....i was really sorry about it. When i arrived there,i found all these people were absolutely wrong. You want luxury,air conditioned,elevators,room service etc???Well,fine for you,so don't book budget hotels like this!!!find 4 stars hotels,residences and stuff like that.They have all comforts but they will charge up to 700 euros for a night in Venice. This hotel is simple,has lots of good comforts as well and the price is lower than 150 for a night(believe me...it'e cheaper to be in Central Venice).Ok that's not a luxury hotel,but you won't need it....they have lots of good services.There is wireless internet connection(even from your room).and you can make international calls with skype!!!,they even have theatre opera,casino and concert tickets.Staff is nice and clever and helps you anytime. Breakfast in the morning is on a buffet,there are lots of choices of jams,coffee,orange juice and cereals. etc..S.Marco is a few steps away and Rialto is 5 minutes walk,and to reach it,you will walk around the historical and fashion districts with lots of stores for your shopping.There is even a very special typical italian restaurant next to this hotel.The neighbourhood is safe and quiet in the night,there are always people walking around,by the way,the hotel is not noisy at all. I didn't found mosquitos in my room,the hotel is completely renuvated and has clean and comfortable rooms with TV (local),bathroom,A/C and extra bed if needed. I really don't know how can some people say,it's disgusting!!!That's not true....Ok,there's no elevator...but you are in Venice,the whole city is a museum!!!Venetian palaces are 500 years old....how can they afford an elevator???If you feel uncomfortable,go to Hilton or Sheraton and pay 400 euro more to stay in the luxury using elevators......but far from Venice. This hotel is situated in the heart of Venice,you don't need to take boats or taxis to visit Venice's most important attractions and monuments.It's simple,essential and very easy to find. Want to live like Venetian people and feel the whole Venetian spirit???Well,go to Astoria!!!:-D

Reviews.Title: “Location Great...But Thats About It....”
Reviews.Author: missa019
Reviews.Content: I was travelling last year throughout Europe with my two sisters. When trying to find a room in Venice that had a great location but was reasonably cheaper than other hotels in the city, we stubbled upon the Hotel Astoria on a hotel website. When we first arrived everything seemed to be ok....except that they insisted that we pay cash for our room...which was kind of a nuisance. But we obliged. Not to mention the fact that we had to give our room key everytime we left the hotel. Anyway, we were taken up to our room and this is where things started to go terribly. The room we were assigned had a broken door....there was a very clear and visible crack all along the top of the door into our room. It seemed to be broken and did not close properly. The hotel also did not have air conditioning when the website had clearly stated that it did have AC. In addition, all the baseboards were falling off of the walls and the bathroom was by far the worse. I will try to explain it as best as I can. You basically had to step over a step to get into the bathroom. When you first enter the sink is to your right....and there's a curtain in front of you....if you move the curtain your suddenly in the shower (??)....in behind that curtain is a second curtain and when you move that one you find the toilet. It was gross.....I never took off my flip flops because I was scared of what was on that floor! We were only there for one night (thank gosh!) so we soon found ourselves checking out and happily leaving! I'm pretty sure that there are worse hotels out there than this one....I guess it really wasn't that bad for a short stay like ours but I wouldn't recommend it for longer stays in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here- it will spoil your experience of Beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rhizabella
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been travelling around Europe for nearly 3 months and have not come across such a strange place! We had the highest of hopes for Venice, however due to our strange experience with Hotel Astoria it was really spoiled. We left this hotel feeling quite angry. Here are a few of our thoughts: 1. The heating and cold water did not work for 2 nights 2. The staff were incredibly rude and had the worst attitude. When the heating and the cold water were not working there were no apologies. 3. The breakfast was embarrassingly sparse 4. You had to leave your room key every time you left the hotel. That didnt feel like god security. 5. A broken shower 6. The cleaner somehow taking the complimentary soap in her daily cleaning routine (????) Its funny to think we didnt even book this hotel. We had originally booked at Casa Linger 10 mins away. When we had arrived at Casa Linger it was under renovation and the workmen gave us a card for another hotel (Astoria) to go there instead. This was the last thing we felt like doing after having already lugged our backpacks all over Venice to find the place! There were no aplogies from staff when we arrived at Astoria and we had never been told by Casa Linger prior to arrival that there was a change in our booking. We suggest only booking at Astoria if there are no other places available in Venice. There are heaps of options, make sure you shop wisley and you will love Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad!”
Reviews.Author: Cliffe
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this Hotel is the location. Our room was a very small double, you could not walk around the bed and had to jump over it to open the window. The bathroom was pretty grim with black mould growing in the shower and the walls of the room were full of squashed mosquitoes. There was a T.V but it didn't work - however the fan did so that was a bonus. We also had the same problem as other people have mentioned over paying by card - the owner says he can accept visa but then pretends the machine is broken when you come to pay, just a ploy to get cash. This hovel should not really be allowed to call itself a hotel, I have stayed in much better hostels with far superior facilities. This place really is a rip off, your better off paying a bit more in Venice and at least enjoying your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but super close to Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everyone else seems to hate this place, but we liked it when staying there for 2 nights in early fall 2003. We wanted to be close to Piazza San Marco, and it definately was. Literally a few short "blocks" away. We had a good experience with the staff, a gentleman who spoke English well. The breakfast was slightly above average. The rooms were expensive, but I expected as much with the location. It was nice to look out of our window and see the belltower in Piazza San Marco and hear it ring. Room was clean and we had no complaints there. Phones worked in rooms, which was somethign we did not find throughout the rest of our trip in Italy. Maybe this place has changed in the 3 years since we've been, but if you're staying in Venice only a few nights, you can't get a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk from the Astoria”
Reviews.Author: rainjoy
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Astoria only to be told that there was a problem. They said they didn't get my reservation in time although I booked it online two months prior to my arrival. The woman at the desk told me that I would be taken to another hotel. When I asked her what hotel and if it was close by, she said she didn't know, she didn't live in Venice. After a 10 minute wait a man came up to me and asked me if I was ready to go to the other hotel. No apologies or explanations were offered.This place, Casa Linger, was something out of a Dickens novel.The room was in the back of the hotel, in a seperate area a few steps below lobby level. It was horrific. Itsmelled like mold and vinegar, the only window led out to the corridor, where the light shown in nonstop( the shutter was broken so I couldn't block out the light).The shower was simply a drain in the floor next to the toilet. No stall, no curtain, nothing. Just aim the water as best you can in the drain or toilet. The blanket was dirty and stained, and when I took it off the bed 2 moths flew out. I was in shock and so tired from my long flight. I agreed to spend 1 night there if I couldn't find another place that day, since I was alone. I found another hotel but they had no room for that night so I sat outside in the rain until 1:30 in the morning and ran out at daybreak. I said I wasn't paying a dime more than the 10% deposit I made online for that horrible room. The rest of my stay in Venice was fabulous, and I soon forgot the Hotel Astoria. So should you.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Astoria
HotelInfo.Address: 951 Calle Fiubera San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
